bibl.title: The Conundrum of P. Teb. II 327.
bibl.note: The ad captandum language of P. Tebt. II, 327 (ca. A.D. 181), a petition presented by a woman to the epistrategos. In lines 15-23, she employs a subterfuge, treating a demand for money withheld by her deceased father during a liturgy as a demand that she complete the liturgy in his stead.
bibl.seg: LEWIS Naphtali, The Conundrum of P. Teb. II 327.

The ad captandum language of P. Tebt. II, 327 (ca. A.D. 181), a petition presented by a woman to the epistrategos. In lines 15-23, she employs a subterfuge, treating a demand for money withheld by her deceased father during a liturgy as a demand that she complete the liturgy in his stead.
